Release Notes - Continuum - Version 1.2.3
The Apache Continuum team is pleased to announce Apache Continuum 1.2.3
As the first public release since Continuum 1.2, version 1.2.2 resolves a security issue in which scm passwords were exposed in plain text in the log files. Users who have password protected scm repositories are encouraged to upgrade and take precautions to secure any log files written by Continuum 1.2.
In addition, this release contains many fixes and improvements, including new configuration options and XML-RPC methods.
Changes in Continuum 1.2.3
Bug
[CONTINUUM-1915] - Continuum 1.2 does not build the project when it has changes in sub-modules and the m2 build is recursive
[CONTINUUM-1953] - [regression] Build definitions not linked when creating a new project with a given build defintion template
[CONTINUUM-1978] - regression from 1.1 to 1.2.2: Add Maven 2.0+ Project using https POM Url where the source server has self signed certificate
[CONTINUUM-1981] - Error while using Windows domain in username when adding a M2 project
[CONTINUUM-1984] - Dead link to data-management-cli-1.2-app.jar in upgrade documentation
[CONTINUUM-1985] - Releasing projects without local repo throws NPE
[CONTINUUM-1987] - Unable to release when local repo used by the project is different from the local repo in the settings.xml
[CONTINUUM-2008] - Creating or Editing "build definition" and "build definition template" generates javascript error
Improvement
[CONTINUUM-1958] - useEditMode option when releasing
[CONTINUUM-1968] - Please add german localization
Task
[CONTINUUM-1973] - Continuum purging has no logs
Have Fun !
--
The Apache Continuum Team
